meanings.definition: Having small, shallow indentations or depressions
meanings.sent1: The orange peel was dimply to the touch.
meanings.sent2: Her dimply skin reminded me of a golf ball.
meanings.sent3: The dimply surface of the moon made it look like a giant golf ball in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The dimply texture of the wall added a unique charm to the room.
meanings.sent5: The dimply appearance of the pudding made it look extra delicious.

meanings.definition: Covered in small, shallow indentations or depressions
meanings.sent1: The dimply surface of the lake reflected the sunlight beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The dimply road made the ride a bit bumpy.
meanings.sent3: The dimply texture of the cake made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: Her dimply cheeks flushed with embarrassment.
meanings.sent5: The dimply pattern on the fabric added a touch of elegance to the dress.
